title: DNC announces date for November Democratic debate to be held in Georgia
text:
CLOSE Some of the Democratic presidential candidates involved in Thursday night's debate in Houston spoke to reporters afterwards and made the cases for their candidacies. (Sept. 13) AP, AP

WASHINGTON – The November Democratic primary debate will be held on Nov. 20 in Georgia and co-hosted by MSNBC and the Washington Post, the Democratic National Convention announced Tuesday.

The fifth debate will be aired live on MSNBC and across the Radio One network, as well as online for both NBC News and MSNBC and through The Post's web and mobile apps.

NBC News said eight candidates in the large field so far appear to have qualified. The venue, format and moderators have yet to be announced.

They are: former Vice President Joe Biden; Sen. Cory Booker of New Jersey; South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg; Sen. Kamala Harris of California; Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont; billionaire and activist Tom Steyer; Sen. Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts; and entrepreneur Andrew Yang.

Former Housing and Urban Development Secretary Julián Castro, Minnesota Sen. Amy Klobuchar, Hawaii Rep. Tulsi Gabbard and former Texas Rep. Beto O'Rourke, all of whom qualified for the Oct. 15 debate, have not yet qualified for November's event.

To qualify for the November debate, candidates must receive individual donations from at least 165,000 people, consisting of at least 600 unique donors in at least 20 states.This is up from the previous requirement of 130,000 donors and at least 400 donors in 20 states, which were the marks set for the September and October debates.

The polling threshold has also been bumped up but includes another category of polls that could be used to qualify. Candidates must stand at 3% or higher in at least four approved national or early state polls. Or they can reach 5% or higher in two early state polls. Early states include Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina and Nevada.

Candidates must meet the polling and fundraising thresholds by Nov. 13 at 11:59 p.m.

The DNC has listed 15 polls it will accept for qualifying. The polls must be conducted between Sept. 13 and a week before the date of the November debate, which is yet to be announced.

Stacey Abrams, the former gubernatorial candidate of the state, said she is “thrilled” the debate is being hosted in Georgia, stating they “are the premier battleground state up and down the ballot, and we look forward to welcoming the candidates on November 20.”

I’m thrilled that next month’s Democratic presidential debate will be held in Georgia. We are the premier battleground state up and down the ballot, and we look forward to welcoming the candidates on November 20. #gapol — Stacey Abrams (@staceyabrams) October 8, 2019

Contributing: Jeanine Santucci
